title: Conditional Probability Formula
text: The conditional probability of A given B may be computed by means of the following formula: P(A$$\mid$$B)=P(A$$∩$$B)/P(B). This can be rewritten as P(A$$∩$$B)=P(A$$\mid$$B)*P(B)

title: Sample Spaces
text: Let B1 denote the event "first marble is black," B2 denote the event "second marble is black," W1 denote the event "first marble is white," and W2 denote the event "second marble is white." Then P(B2$$∩$$B1)=P(B2$$\mid$$B1)*P(B1)

title: P(B1)
text: What is the probability that the first marble drawn is black? Enter your answer as a fraction

subHints.title: P(B1)
subHints.text: When the first marble is drawn, 7 marbles are black out of the 10 possible marbles chosen. Therefore, the probability of drawing a black marble is $$\frac{7}{10}$$

title: P(B2$$\mid$$B1)
text: What is the probability that the second marble drawn is black? Enter your answer as a fraction

title: P(B2$$\mid$$B1)
text: When the second marble is drawn, 6 marbles are black out of the 9 possible marbles chosen. Therefore, the probability of drawing a black marble is $$\frac{6}{9}$$
